website_summaries.verdict: With its dedicated battery backup configuration, this modest-looking UPS delivers plenty of power for multiple electronics.
pros: Provides at least 30 minutes of backup power to electronics
Includes silent mode to prevent annoying alert beeps
Includes software for more precise UPS control
cons: Battery performance may degrade significantly after the first 12 to 18 months

customer_reviews.title: Great Balls Of Fire!
customer_reviews.text: Have you ever lit a Roman candle in your house? That's what I experienced today when I turned this unit on, big fireball shot out one of the electrical ports. Wanted to see where the fireball came from so I took it apart (see attached photo). Not surprised though at the poor quality of these APC units, had another unit that came with a damaged plug (BE500G). Took it apart thinking I could swap out the cord and found damaged wires inside (see attached photo). So if you value your life and you won't want your house catching fire, I'd find another UPS manufacturer, I know I will!
customer_reviews.author: Ann T.

customer_reviews.title: No Mode/Mute button for the audio Alarm!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this battery backup unit and it appears to function properly. However for a $100+ battery backup from the APC brand it should have a 30 cent switch to mute the audio alarm when required. There are situations where you already know the power is off and are managing the situation that you don't need yet another alarm making a bunch of racket. It is ridiculous that there is no way to mute the audio alarm on this rather expensive device when all it would take is a simple button. Had I realized that it was missing this simple and obvious feature I would not have purchased this device.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cottrell , Raleigh

customer_reviews.title: Outlets aren’t all usable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this due to the large number of outlets, but they are so close together almost nothing goes fits into them. Making half of them effectively useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amt

customer_reviews.title: Plugs don't fit
customer_reviews.text: So...I bought this thinking I could use it for my desk electronics: Laptop, two monitors, computer hub, printer, speakers etc. but the plugs didn't all fit. Anything with a third prong would not go in. Turns out they were shaped incorrectly. I called Amazon got a replacement quickly. Now I am sitting here with the replacement and it has the same issue. So...if you only need to plug in items with a two prong electrical cord, have at it. Otherwise, skip this one.
customer_reviews.author: moreruckus2

customer_reviews.title: Failed a critical test
customer_reviews.text: The first time the power went out, this thing worked like a champ, and kept all my networking equipment running perfectly. However, when the power came back on, the unit did not do what I expected: Instead of reverting back to drawing A/C power, it continued to use the battery. Finally, after some time, it started beeping to indicate that the battery was low. I double checked the electrical outlet, and power was good. I unplugged the unit, and plugged it back in but it still did not recognize that grid power was available. Eventually the battery ran down all the way, and it shut down all my equipment. Surely this cannot be how it's intended to work!
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: This is why you can't write a review until sometime has passed
customer_reviews.text: So in 2008 I bought an APC backup from Amazon and it lasted till 2017, when the battery went dead. Given the price of the battery ($35+) and the never ending need for USB ports I bought this model. About a week ago I started noticing a stink in the living room that resembled that fond burning electronics odor. Then on Saturday night the unit just stopped working. Something seriously wrong with quality in everything nowadays. Going through the warranty process but given I was only using this as surge suppressor and USB charger with the same load as the previous one for about 10 years... something literally smells funny with APC quality
customer_reviews.author: Mike E

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to keeping the home network running
customer_reviews.text: There are many variations of APC UPS out there and I find this one is the best combination of price, outlets, capacities and design. I use it to power my home network (see photo) equipment, including UPS for the firewall and Fios Router, the WIFI router (orbi), a Samsung smartthing hub for home control, and a NAS for storing critical backups and data at home. The APC UPS is connected to my NAS via USB so that if we loose power, the NAS will do a clean shutdown to make sure there is no data lost. For short term power loss (we have experienced up to 5 mins) or brown outs, the equipment completely stay running.
customer_reviews.author: Pk Shiu

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY - Get a different APC model
customer_reviews.text: We love our other APC products, but this guy has been a nightmare. It will randomly BEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEP. And it won't stop until you press the power button and reset it. At first we thought it may be sensitive to power fluxuations or something, but it's been so random we just can't narrow down the cause. We searched in the manual for why it would do this and there is NO behavior of this type outlined. We called APC and they sent us a replacement (great customer service). But guess what?? The replacement does the exact same thing AND didn't backup our item when the power went out. We'll be calling APC yet again...
customer_reviews.author: Nursoph

customer_reviews.title: Already 1 hour into power failure and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: We've had a number of split-second power failures since I purchased these over a year ago, but this is the first time the power is continuously out. It is now just over an hour, and all 4 of them are still going strong. Back in February, we had a power failure for just a split second 1 morning due to a snowstorm, and all of my equipment was fine. My neighbors and friends nearby all had their modems go down, and they were unable to reconnect to the internet for many hours because the node was unable to handle all the modems coming online at once. I never lost internet access at all. Love these battery backups!
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl

customer_reviews.title: Can't handle my computers power draw.
customer_reviews.text: I have this powering my home PC and when gaming it has long sustained beeps as if the battery is low power. Why is it pulling from battery power all the time instead of passing the outlet through? This thing isn't fit to power anything more than your grandmother's CRT TV.
customer_reviews.author: Jeramy G.

customer_reviews.title: Problem with an APC UPS for the first time
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for about four weeks. Then it could not be turned on unless you pulled out the plug and plugged it back, which made me think that the outlet was defective. My electrician installed a new outlet, but the problem continued. I have since installed an APC Surge Protector, Model PER7 and is working flawlessly. This is the first time I have had a problem with an APC UPS; I have used different models in the past without any problems. I will dump this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jose E. Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: I love it, and so does my generator.
customer_reviews.text: We have used the APC products for years, but after purchasing a whole house generator we found that the older models do not like the dirty power from the generator so they keep beeping. This one does not. Instead of just getting one for the computers, I also purchased units for our Television, TV accessories, and our router. Now when we have the 15 second delay in getting power, we never lose the settings in our TV or other accessories. I think I will get one more for the TV and clock in the bedroom. I would not use it for stand alone power, but it is a perfect compliment for our generator during power transfer.
customer_reviews.author: gacleader1

customer_reviews.title: Piece of a garbage..!
customer_reviews.text: Its for APC 600VA ups model. This is a piece of garbage.there is a constant humming sound,when it is powered on and not silent at all.since i installed it in my study room,so cannot concentrate when its powered on.its out of return period so am gonna throw it out today.just wasted my hard earned money.i Do Not recommend anybody to waste her/his money and precious time on it.buy some other good brand.trust me on this or regret later.
customer_reviews.author: Pole star

customer_reviews.title: Works with my Generac Whole-House Generator
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit specifically because other reviews stated that it works with the “Dirty Power” from a Generac Generator. The first thing I did after installing it was to turn off my main-breaker to simulate a power-failure and let the generator kick-in. It worked perfectly and was perfectly happy to let my computer run on the “Dirty” power from the generator, rather than ignore the generator and deplete the battery as my old UPS did. If that is not sufficient for your needs, according to the manual you can set it to a mode where it accepts even dirtier power, however I don’t seem to need that, so I have not tinkered with that option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warning: these are bot new. Refurbished units shipped
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these. Nowhere in the description does it say they’re refurbished, but both of them had refurbished test print outs on them. I also purchased another lower capacity unit but that one was actually new. It appears to work so I didn’t return them but Amazon should make these listings more transparent...this misrepresentation appears to be a persistent problem.
customer_reviews.author: Wan

customer_reviews.title: UPS BE600M1
customer_reviews.text: I have been using APC UPS for 15 years, in my professional and home life. I am pretty upset that these devices do not last. The batteries are always needing to be replaced and the units fail right after the warranty is completed. Now I purchase one with a removable battery and when I get it home I find that its a non-standard battery that is only available through APC and is very expensive. Is it like the printer market where the batteries are like ink cartridges and thats where they make their money??? !!! Not satisfied. I will most likely go to another vender the next time I need a UPS.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Solid UPC and Software...who put the glue on the plastic?
customer_reviews.text: So far, the UPC is working well, software is solid. Two negatives led to the 4 star: 1. Oddly can't handle the amps of my printer spooling up, so I have to run the printer on the surge only outlets. 2. Whatever glue they used on the the cellophane to put over the "shiny" plastic left a ton of residue. I had to use an ungodly amount of goo gone, which of course damaged the "shiny" surface anyways. No idea why they don't test these things.
customer_reviews.author: W. Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: This model provides no surge protection. I had a power surge, and it not only killed the internet router this this was supposed to protect it killed the the UPS itself.
customer_reviews.author: Gen4ten

customer_reviews.title: Shame on APC.  Do not buy.  Will die quickly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit a little over one year ago and after letting it off for 6 months, it just would not come back to life. Complete piece of you-know-what. Do not waste your money. Shame on APC
customer_reviews.author: Los Angeles Dweller

customer_reviews.title: 600VA Model - hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased four of these for my company. Three of them were totally fine and have been working without any issues for almost a year. The most recent one was DOA. The PowerChute software was "unable" to carry out a self-test, and said that I needed a new battery. If you order one of these, be careful unpacking it in case you need to return it for a bad battery. As long as you get a good battery, I think this is a pretty good unit. For what it's worth, I've purchased about a dozen of the 550VA models, and only had one issue, so I suppose they have a better success rate in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I've used APC UPS backup products for years where I work and they have always been reliable...
customer_reviews.text: I've used APC UPS backup products for years where I work and they have always been reliable. Those unit were/are a lot larger than the current ones that I've ordered for home use, but I'm hoping that they will be just as reliable for the long haul. I ordered 2 units and they both arrived in perfect working order. I'm using one for my iMac, cable internet/voice modem/router, VOiP phone, and 2 external backup drives. The second unit is being used with my MacBook and backup drive. The only issue is that the optional software that you can use to control other functions of the unit is only for Windows, so us Mac users are out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: road66warrior

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Great for keeping desktop PC or TV & DVR running without a hitch during short power interruptions or momentary power glitches that are very common in rural areas. This one backs up my bedroom 37-in LCD TV and DVR remote. I use a similar, but higher capacity (800 VA), APC UPS for 55-in TV, DVR, and satellite TV modem located in living room. For my desktop PC, router, and satellite internet modem, I use a 1,000 VA true sine-wave APC UPS in order to have close to 1/2-hr backup, or for very brief connections for weather forecasts and emergency services during long power interruptions.
customer_reviews.author: prag

customer_reviews.title: Not good for home gaming rigs.
customer_reviews.text: I have a DSL router, my PC (650w ps), 1 monitor(40w) plugged into the battery backup slots and every once in a while if I'm playing a game I'll get warning beeps indicating I'm over the batteries capacity to support if the power goes out. It would probably work fine for a laptop/monitor combo, but I was expecting it to support my rig based on some other reviews. It has both saved me during power flickers and failed during flickers. If i were to buy again, I would get a bigger unit.
customer_reviews.author: try it

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for an Old APC
customer_reviews.text: Has the same surge protection and battery back-up capabilities I had in the old and larger model. My only complaint is the spacing between the outlets. Seems to be configured more for normal plugs. I have three devices with AC adapters that come in various sizes/shapes (Router, Modem, External Drive) and they are hard to configure and find a place to plug in without overlapping and covering an outlet. So one of the Battery Backup outlets is not useable.
customer_reviews.author: Willowisp

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be very popular as a UPS.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two units of these cuz a hurricane (Dorian) is approaching and I need extra power coverage when the storm hits the grid. The batteryt is not easy to connect but I did it after a patient tryout with both units. I thought it would come factory precharged by default,but that does not seem to be the case.As the storm approaches I feel kinda anxious having to wait for at least 16 hours!!!... I hope not to be disappointed when in time of needing them for back up.m
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Maffongelli

customer_reviews.title: The  warnings -  Danger / Caution -  should  be  included,  on  the  Amazon  web-site / page.
customer_reviews.text: This device, should have a Medical / Alert - warning. Such as - NOT compatible with some Medical devices / equipment. Hazard of Electric Shock, Explosion, or ARC Flash. If I had known about these problems - I NEVER, would have ordered, this device / unit. The warnings - Danger / Caution - should include - Medical Alert. I did NOT see, these warnings - on the Amazon web-page. Note - due to car problems, I was NOT able to get to, the U P S, store - maybe, Wed / Thurs. Keep up the Good Work, Thanks, Bob
customer_reviews.author: RIR

customer_reviews.title: You had one job!
customer_reviews.text: We had a power outage which lasted several hours. This UPS dutifully kept the computer running as long as the battery lasted. Unfortunately, when the power came back on it must have sent a surge through the lines, as I now have two dead computers. Additionally, the plugs on the battery side no longer provide power at all. When I looked into the equipment warranty, the terms and conditions are such that a claim is unlikely to succeed, and since I didn't register the product within 10 days of purchase, will not be possible for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Starks

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery or bad software, either way it's bad
customer_reviews.text: I tested this UPS after letting it charge for about 16 hours, then plugging my computer into it (the UPS reports being under 7% load) and shutting off the mains power. After only 11 seconds on battery, the UPS reports the battery charge going down to 87%, and it has stayed at 87% even after turning the mains power back on and letting it charge for an hour. Whether the battery is bad, or the data coming out of the UPS is bad, how am I supposed to trust this?
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: 600VA not powerful enough for desktops.
customer_reviews.text: The desktop tested is not the most powerful computer not the least. Core i7 and a 24" led monitor. It works fine if the PC is just idling but once I start using it, it abruptly shuts off. If it won't run your average desktop then I'm really not sure what is its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzz

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This works great! My apartment recently began experiencing power flickers several times a month. Instead of complaining like all my neighbors I just ordered this APC battery backup. Now I don't even notice the flickers. It's not a generator though!! It will keep a TV and Xbox powered for about 30min-1hour after power loss in my experience. The main reason I got this, besides the headache of losing power, is because I have a NAS running 24/7 and those power loss/surges can be damaging. This APC battery backup gives me enough time to safely power down my NAS, or keep it running long enough for the power to be restored. It's paid for itself already in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor H.

customer_reviews.title: Secure constant power protection.
customer_reviews.text: APC UPS, 600VA UPS Battery Backup & Surge Protector, BE600M1 is a great mid-range secure constant stable surge protector with battery backup for most home users. It does what it is meant to do; protect your system's equipment from irregular power fluctuation, while giving you a small safe window of battery power to shutdown your system in a power outage. Build quality is what should be expected from APC and in fact goes above my expectations. Initial setup is simple, straight forward and fast. If you want to insure your computer or other equipment from unstable power while having a small window of battery backup power; then I recommend the APC UPS, 600VA UPS Battery Backup & Surge Protector, BE600M1.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Duncan

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my computer workstation and had my laptop, computer monitor, ATT modem and a HP inkjet printer connected to it. Just 3 days after it was installed I experienced a power outage and everything lost power (except the laptop, since it has its own battery power supply). The printer, ATT modem and the computer monitor lost power during the outage and they are all plugged in properly in the power outlets to get power from the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: I-Test-Everything

customer_reviews.title: Works great for wifi network backup power on boat.
customer_reviews.text: We use this unit to provide backup power for our household router that provides internet service to all of our household including alarm system. It is installed on a boat. The backup lasts about 45 minutes without wifi service interruption. This is really important because whenever we move the boat power is disconnected temporarily until the generator switches over or we hook back up to shore power. Using this UPS we never lose wifi when switching power sources. The only reason I didn't rate it five stars is that the battery has to be replaced every two years or so because it loses it's reserve capacity. It would be nice it the batteries lasted a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Running my Wi-Fi router, TV, Blue ray player, and bookshelf speakers. Bought it mostly for the Wi-Fi because my wife is working from home and I'm going to college online. My power is unstable during thunderstorms. Tested my backup by plugging in the router then unplugging the battery from the wall. I'm NOT advising anyone do this because of the risk of electrical shock and Death. I didn't want to wait until I was doing something important to figure out that it didn't work. My unit works to keep power to my WiFi router.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: APC has abandoned quality
customer_reviews.text: Have had this unit only a few months and the internal battery has already died. Prior APC units have lasted 4 or 5 years before I changed the battery. I have even upgraded to larger external batteries. However this unit you can not replace the battery. I am disappointed because that should have been IN ALL CAPS AND BOLD in the product description.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: NO WAY TO SILENCE IT
customer_reviews.text: You paid good money for it, but you do NOT have a method to silence this thing. I bought it BECAUSE I noticed power fluctuation which I was concerned would corrupt / destroy my electronics. Now I'm beginning to think I should have done more research and found a model that will actually let you permanently silence the device without a constant USB being plugged in!! .. THIS SUCKS BAD! having to get up an push the button every 5 minutes!! I'm going to look for a way to permanently break the speaker in it .. else I'll seek a full refund and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Daxx

customer_reviews.title: Good battery backup, weak USB charging
customer_reviews.text: At least the specifications were clear about the amperage of the USB charger-- I can confidently say that this will not fast-charge USB devices which have the capability. In fact, if I use it to charge my phone, I can only get it to "slow charge". I'm knocking a star off for that-- it's 2020, more USB charging devices should be capable of fast charge. But, as far as being a battery backup is concerned, it has successfully powered 2 good-sized aquarium filters, 1 heater, and 2 large LED lights. If you're buying this, don't count on using the USB port as a primary phone charger.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Cavnar

customer_reviews.title: cannot be used as UPS for computer equipment
customer_reviews.text: i bought it because it has 6 UPS Battery Backup with Surge Protection Outlets. It can protect my computer equipments from power outage, especially outage happened quite often because of high temperature. I spent time to set it up but found out the 4 outlets cannot support 3 prong plug, even though they all have 3 holes. I'm not sure it's a defect or not, but all of my computer stuffs use 3 prong plugs therefore the ups becomes useless. I've double check the product description but this special feature is not mentioned at all. I'll return it back and keep shopping the UPS.
customer_reviews.author: Y. FEI

customer_reviews.title: Kept two aquariums safe! Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: I had two power outages earlier this year with one lasting 24 hours. I have two aquariums with fish and the filters and heaters were off. Talk about stressful. Purchased two of these and just had a 3 hour outage but no real knowledge of how long this time. I did not worry one moment and saw the red heater light in the dark assuring me my aquatic animals were cozy and safe. My neighbor called me crying because her fan was off and she was very hot so I suggested she buy one as well. Buying one for my router to keep internet going. I would buy a forth if found I needed one. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: junk - DON'T buy it
customer_reviews.text: after less than 2 years, I had a power failure this unit did not hold my (low demand fiber optic device) for even a few minutes battery is shot when unplugged, it does not hold power just cheap junk that gives the semblance of actually doing something
customer_reviews.author: Dbar

customer_reviews.title: Meh! Quality dropping or used product being sold as new
customer_reviews.text: The USB port has obviously taken some abuse! Seems like another used/returned product being sold as new. Decided to keep it for the location it is needed, but not going to buy another one from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Carnivore

customer_reviews.title: Connected to a Synology NAS with no issues
customer_reviews.text: I had no trouble setting this up with my Synology DS213 NAS. It detected the UPS right away and is configured to shut down properly should a power outage occur long enough to drain the battery on the UPS. I haven't had a power outage since buying the unit, so I'll update the review if I have any trouble. Update: As fate would have it, the power went out later on the same day I wrote this review. My NAS stayed online for over 2 hours on the UPS and did not need to shut down. I'll update again in the event the NAS undergoes a clean shutdown after being on UPS long enough for the battery to drain.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Didn't make it 9 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought it in March and since then it's run a relatively light load, with a few lights and small electronics on it, being used no more than 8-10 hours a day. One day recently I plug in an iPhone charger to the surge protector plug and BAM, power off and the breaker for that room was flipped. Almost nothing else running on that breaker. I unplugged everything and plugged them directly to the outlet, flipped the breaker and everything ran just fine. The second I plugged up the UPS back in (nothing plugged into it) and BAM there goes the breaker again. For such a short lifespan I can't say the cost of this thing is even remotely justified.
customer_reviews.author: DDon

customer_reviews.title: Work well until they fail
customer_reviews.text: We have APC UPS on all our electronic equipment, mostly the 1500 VA models. But for one of our WiFi extenders which draws vary little power, we use this lower capacity model. While for the larger models, we get about 6-7 years (one battery replacement); this model only lasts 12-24 months. Not a battery issue as replacing the battery with a genuine APC battery doesn't restore them to working order. We do find APC units to be more reliable than other brands and have been using them for over 30 years.
customer_reviews.author: TwoMetreBill

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Good Backup sytem.
customer_reviews.text: Got this because my spouse is working from home, we would get a little light flicker and the Cable router would go into restart mode and she would lose her place or her work. This fixed that problem right off. This item is heavy and a little bulky but that because it has a battery inside that can be replaced when it goes out in a few years where others can not. Since I bought this the power company found the problem in the connection at the power pole. I really like this as it works great for what it does. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: pete

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to protest my Synology DS1817+ NAS during lightning storm and power outages. The device was incredibly easy to set up, just take it out of the box, connect it to power and the device you want to protect. For those curious if Synology detects the UPS, it does (see attached photo) and even determines how much battery lead time you have before it will send the shutdown signal to protect itself. Great value for the price and protection offered. No issues so far would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: M S Mc Cright

customer_reviews.title: Nice UPS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3d printer to protect against brown outs. You don't want to be in the middle of a 20 hour print and have it ruined by a couple minutes of power loss. My kit printer didn't include a power switch, so I was able to use the UPS power button to turn it on and off without unplugging it. Three days after I installed it, the cheap chinese power supply on my printer shorted out. The short circuit protection on this UPS stopped my power supply from blowing up and tripping the breaker. That would have been a nightmare because my other 3d printer was on the same circuit.
customer_reviews.author: Ed B.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This works great, I didn't get a version with WiFi, I didn't know they had them but don't need it. This has already come in handy. With summer and rolling blackouts, I didn't want anything to happen to my samsung tv, xbox one x, or home theater system. I have already lost a cheap tv in this new location, so I didn't want to risk the new setup. This battery backup has already given me time to turn everything off correctly. I do recommend this is you're not planning to put too many devices on it.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good so far
customer_reviews.text: This has been a good UPS so far. Setup was easy—simply connect the battery and plug in. You can also configure various settings—including disabling the alarm—using downloaded software from APCs website. The only con is that it emits a small high pitch frequency from inside the unit. It’s not enough that it’s unbearable, but you can definitely notice that it’s there if you’re close enough to the unit. Not a deal breaker for me, but if you are sensitive to things like this I would recommend you avoid. Otherwise you won’t be disappointed, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Bluffnix

customer_reviews.title: Very dependable backup
customer_reviews.text: This is a great backup. Using it in my audio studio. We’ve had several blackouts and brownouts and APC has saved the day. No problems at all and gives me ample time to shut the system down with time to spare. I run a Mac Pro, 2 displays, 2-8” powered monitors, 7 external drives, presonus studio 1824c and a faderport. Those of u in audio know about this stuff. So I’m totally happy with my APC 650VA. 👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Alan R Lowther

customer_reviews.title: Love this UPS
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted for my home office! I liked it so much I bought 3 of them. I now have one hooked up to my incoming modem, a second one hooked up to my wifi router and network switch and the third one is in my office with my monitor, printer, and laptop. Now if I lose power for a few minutes I do not lose the internet or anything else!
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Very efficient,  Blue Light on power button is too bright.  Happy with the UPS.
customer_reviews.text: According to APC's web site this UPS is much more energy efficient than older units. The battery is also user replaceable so that you don't need to throw this away in 4 years when the battery dies. So I bought it. It works. But it's in the bedroom and the blue light from the power button lights up the room. Since the light is literally in the power button the usual hack of covering it with electrical tape does not work. Not sure yet how I'll fix it (if you know how, please comment).
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Performance! Only worked untested for 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to prevent my wifi router from turning off in the event of a storm. The router was the only thing plugged into it and we had a storm. The lights flickered briefly and it started bleeping nonstop. It did not maintain power to the router. Afterwards it does not function anymore. The circuit breaker push button was not extended. I did push it anyways. I do not suggest this for anyone who wants an ounce of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jake A. Neal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this battery backup and my tech set it up for me so I have no way of testing it but I like that it's not big and bulky. It connected to wifi no problem. I can't comment on tech support or sleep mode because I just got it. but my tech said it was nice and easy for him to set up. Very happy so far thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Grace W

customer_reviews.title: APC is one the of the Top 2 brands to go to for Battery backups and surge defense
customer_reviews.text: I have had decades of experience with APC both in global enterprise settings and down to the mom and pop consumer level. Over the years I have seen pluses and minuses with the APC products but none that would lead me to regret their brand and my unexpected loyalty over the years. I needed something for the home, to protect my NAS and clean up some power loss prevention concerns I had for other light power consuming devices. So far this design, the number of ports and features has exceeded my needs and requirements. Its been one month but I am happy at this point with a well working protective APC solution in my cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: mike000mike

customer_reviews.title: Failed on first use
customer_reviews.text: Product failed on its first use. Bought on June 6th, lost power on June 30th, and it can’t support my modem. Will work for my cell charger but the modem “overloads” it. Tech support spent thirty minutes asking me questions and pressing the power button. Replacing it at no charge.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for power backup of router
customer_reviews.text: We have FIOS and while the ONT has a power backup, the router does not. We get a lot of micro-power-outages in Northern Westchester, you loose electricity for a few seconds. That is annoying when you work from home because both your router and your cable box now start this several-minutes long reboot. Worse, loosing power while working on web-based applications may cause data loss. This UPS is the perfect and affordable solution. Coverage will Depend on what you connect, in my case the router should last for 1h.
customer_reviews.author: nadanix

customer_reviews.title: Door Stop
customer_reviews.text: Piece of garbage. Have had it 5 weeks when Hurricane Irma was hit. Power out 22 hours. Turned on computer last night and all well. Tonight, turned it on and after two hours the UPC crashed. Turns out that after the power outage this unit requires 16 hours to recharge. You can't use it while battery is charging. Had to plug computer and monitor into outlets that are only surge protected. Nice sure suppressor for a couple of devices.
customer_reviews.author: OrlandoAlan

customer_reviews.title: Ordered and paid for New....clearly this has been used!!
customer_reviews.text: I opted to pay more for a NEW product and am really upset to find has clearly been used. When I opened the battery compartment to find it scratched up as if it was kicked across the floor. Right now appears to be working fine we will see how it does when the power goes out. In meantime will register product warranty that came with it. Just couldn’t give more stars because it wasn’t NEW as stated. So disappointed for that alone!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Compact.  Silent mode. Replaceable battery.
customer_reviews.text: Great for your average UPS needs in terms of power delivery on battery back up. Has plenty of plugs. Is very compact. Has a replaceable battery so that you don't have to replace the whole unit. It also has a silent mode where it won't constantly beep when it's lost power. Only con I would say is that the power LED is a very bright green. If you have this anywhere in sight at night where you don't want light coming form it may bother you.
customer_reviews.author: Acquire

customer_reviews.title: Ancient UPS BackUp - battery saving system - in a new, smaller and affordable package!
customer_reviews.text: All the good things an older UPS (APC) Backup device - sold in a New, smart and efficient package - can give ! Happy with its installation, reliability and function in general. Do NOT forget to register and get the FREE software that allows you to SET your own choices, alarms and all ... Look for "downloads"... ! I bought two of these, for two rooms. The downside is that 300W battery supply DOES NOT provide enough juice for plugging in my Old Plasma (450W itself), but only in surge-protector outlet. If planning to use an UPS for home theater setup, look for a more expensive and higher Wattage: a min. 600Watt!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Nichols

customer_reviews.title: 5 months in and works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this APC UPS mainly due to the price and only wanting to keep a few things online. My internet router primarily as I have Blink XT2 security cameras at the house. They seemed to go offline whenever the internet had a hiccup. Since the install, 0, absolutely ZERO issues with the cameras or internet. I've had 2 power outages since then. One was really prolonged, about 6 hours and the UPC kept the internet, desktop, monitor, and stuff powered for about 40 minutes. When it's a small outage, you can't even tell it's there but the internet stays up.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Marroquin

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK JUNK !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This unit arrived fine from amazon, I got my first power surge and it failed. I have had 4 surges since all failed. I have 4 cyber power units all prefect. This unit works as battery back up if you unplug it. NOT if a lighting storm causes a surge. I would rather have cancer. than anymore APC products.
customer_reviews.author: droid dude

customer_reviews.title: Defeated the purpose of a backup battery.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this product on 4/9/20. Today was the first storm to cause a power outage. My PS4 is plugged into a backup outlet, and the unit still experienced a hard shut down when the power went off. Too be fair there was enough battery power to turn the unit back on and repair the extended hard drive while my power was still off. However, this product was purchased to protect my gaming system from these types of shut downs.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: APC UPS, 600VA UPS Battery Backup & Surge Protector
customer_reviews.text: I received the APC yesterday and man if this thing isn't heavy duty I don't know what it is. I love how on the back or bottom they have run test on it to make sure that it passed everything that needed to make it a great product. I have a set up that can require a lot of power and I want to make sure that my set up doesn't blow out a wall socket nor do I want to be cut off by a store. I haven't gotten a chance to use all the features, but it is very all-inclusive from what I am seeing. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Tearched H. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great product, VERY slow to ship! Not a good business practice...
customer_reviews.text: So far, this surge protector has done its job. Last night we had an intense thunderstorm (Florida-lightning central!) and the unit provided instantaneous protection as we heard, several times, the unit "click" (denotes a potential surge) to engage the protection circuitry. What I am NOT happy about was the fact that it took 6 days to ship AFTER I purchased this unit. This is unacceptable whatever way you slice it!! Sure it got here within the time frame, however that is not how you do business. I will update this review about the longevity of this backup. Just be aware of the "potential" shipping information.
customer_reviews.author: Pipkin Photography and Audio

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - WARRANTY IS USELESS
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this UPS because of the reputation of APC. While the unit apparently works, the Warranty is USELESS since I would have to give my phone number to register. THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NO LEGITIMATE REASON FOR APC OR ANY OTHER SELLER TO REQUIRE YOUR PHONE NUMBER. The real reason for a required phone number is to use it for telemarketing directly or selling the number to a legion of 3rd parties for telemarketing.
customer_reviews.author: ROB675

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with APC
customer_reviews.text: Works great as far as I can tell. We have our modem/router combo, Arlo base station, and an 8 port TP-Link switch plugged into this one. We haven't had a power outage yet, but I will update this review once we've had a chance to see it perform. I did take one star of because the cord is only 5' long. I knew this before ordering, but I really wish it would have been 6 or 7 instead. Apparently this is not a thing with any of the other brands either.
customer_reviews.author: Nick W

customer_reviews.title: Decent UPS
customer_reviews.text: Good UPS. Doesn't last that long if you have a few things plugged into the battery backup. Mine seems to beep at me and turn off when I use the USB port, it must be faulty. The software that you can download to monitor your energy use only works and connects data when your computer is plugged into the UPS. If not plugged in, then it's not connecting data on your energy use. Wish the UPS could do that internally and just synch when connected to computer. Hard to beat a functioning UPS at that price though.
customer_reviews.author: DKP

customer_reviews.title: Used for expensive computer equipment backup and surge protection
customer_reviews.text: Although we have a backup generator that will come on 20 seconds after a power outage, we use this backup so that there is no surge for our expensive computer equipment. There hasn’t been an outage since we purchased this. And although we’ve had some thunderstorms, I don’t believe there have been any electrical surges. So, I don’t know how well it will actually do. It appears to be functioning as described. This is for insurance and I hope it never needs to be utilized.
customer_reviews.author: FJLTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: One outage and it no longer works!
customer_reviews.text: My power went out and I was able to safely shut down my computer within 10 minutes after saving everything. A week later, it started beeping and shut my whole system down - I lost more from that than I would have in the power outage. When I disconnected it, it smelled like burned plastic so it is completely useless now. In the super small print on the "manual", it says I need to replace the batteries but I doubt that will help. After having this for such a short time and only using the batteries for supposedly 10 minutes, this was a TOTAL waste of money and potential safety hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Shari R Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Works well for short power outages - peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I live in an area where we have power blips (too many power lines near trees). Also it takes a bit for my standby generator to kick in. I have my Modem, WiFi Router, and a small LED lamp on this unit. So, my la[tops, and other electronic devices do not loose connectivity due to power blips. Due to the small load, the 650 W power was enough to keep my devices connected for almost 90 minutes! Remember the time depends on the load imposed.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Great for electric recliner and power outages
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with my electric recliner after having been caught twice when there was a sudden power failure. Getting out of an extended recliner is at the very least difficult, and for me, dangerous (senior citizen with arthritis). I now have the recliner plugged into this backup battery. I tested it by pulling the plug out of the wall, then seeing if my recliner would operate. It did. So this is a handy simple solution with extra outlets!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn DumondTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm A MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: Awesome addition a life saver. Before buying this product I only had a surge protector attached to my computer. Needless to say I lost everything cause I lost power during a Windows update, Windows would not even open after getting it on my system had only windows 8. After getting everything that I could back I bought this item. It’s been such a life saver I lost power again and it worked like it was supposed to I’m so happy everything worked the back up power works so well. Buying another for my gaming system and tv
customer_reviews.author: Shirley B

customer_reviews.title: Avoid!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use in my living room for my tv, Xbox, and modem. The moment I turned it on it constantly beeped meaning there was an overload. Narrowed it down to my Xbox One X. This is ridiculous that it can't handle a game console. Returned it and hopefully, a larger unit can handle it.
customer_reviews.author: Stan L.

customer_reviews.title: Working as expected
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these specifically for short term power for a couple of 24 inch flat panel monitors connected to a security system DVR/NVR. The last power outage we had, the monitors remained working for at least 3 hours... then commercial power returned. (The NVR/DVR is on its own much larger battery back up system which also remained up during the outage.)
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Compact, plenty of plugs well spaced out.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the UPS and Power Plug bundle. + Haven’t had to use the UPS thankfully and hoping it stays this way. I like that it’s compact with several plugs including ones not connected to the battery and all are spaced out well. + The power cord is fantastic and it was easy to setup and control the smart plugs via the APC app! They both look great and mostly blend into the background of other stuff in the office, which is a bonus :-)
customer_reviews.author: Sparkkle

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, Great Size, Dependable UPS
customer_reviews.text: This unit isn't for someone looking to run their computer and peripherals for hours during a power outage. The day after this came a storm came through my area and knocked out the power. This thing worked like a charm and gave me time to save my work, and shut down while keeping my PC protected. UPS is a must have to protect your computers, this is perfect for someone who just wants time to do what's needed during power issues.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Lisk

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Work
customer_reviews.text: Had the computer and router hooked up - it started to beep a bunch, then POOF! No warning, just shut off.
customer_reviews.author: I'm a real customer

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect, I have bought multiple and not a single issue with any of them!
customer_reviews.text: These work great, and I have ordered 4 of these over the past 3 years and all of them are working perfect. Battery comes precharged, just connect and plug it in. Standard desktop and monitor will run for over 10 minutes without issue, plenty enough time that when that power goes out, you can save what you are doing close everything out and log off and shut down. Has saved me several times. These are great and I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Just trying to help =)

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Ok. Should have bought something bigger.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these. One has a laptop, docking station, and monitor. Run time is only about 30 minutes. The other is connected to a dedicated security camera desktop PC and POe switch running 5 cams. Run time is about 20 minutes. If there is a power outage my cameras won't last long. It's probably my fault for not calculating the load demand but ain't nobody got time for that. This is fine for my laptop system but very undersized for my security camera system. Also, the software is kind of useless.
customer_reviews.author: K.W.

customer_reviews.title: seems to have plenty of battery
customer_reviews.text: bought 2, hooked one to security camera and one to WiFi unit. Diagnostic software says should provide up to 2 hours of backup to the camera and 5 hours to the WiFi. haven't had a power failure yet but did cut off breaker one day to change plug and both devices kept functioning
customer_reviews.author: Henry S.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great so far
customer_reviews.text: My cable modem takes about 5 minutes to boot and be ready after a power outage and since I am working from home, losing connection in the middle of a meeting for about 5 minutes is not convenient. I bought this UPS and it is only powering mu cable modem and since my laptop has its own battery, when I lose the power in my home, I can continue without any interruption. So far the outages were not longer than 10 to 15 minutes and this UPS worked great.
customer_reviews.author: A. MARANDI

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: After setting it up and making sure the internal battery was properly connected, it was promptly put to the test as our local weather began to heat up. Several times we blew a fuse and every time it failed to provide more than five seconds of battery backup time before cutting power. My older APCs have all worked spectacularly for years, but this unit disappointed spectacularly.
customer_reviews.author: Tenka Digi

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small mountain town with unreliable electricity; this has saved my butt several times. Once it was beeping in a weird way but I looked it up on their website and was able to fix the problem easily. This is my second one, the first lasted a good 9 years.
customer_reviews.author: Jean C. Hofve

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed that this didn't last a full year before the battery died.
customer_reviews.text: Has worked pretty well for about 10 months - powering my cable modem, wifi router, NAS, and SmartThings hub. Unfortunately, it has started to malfunction - a loud, piercing screech emits from the unit (usually at 4am while I'm sleeping), indicating that the battery is either bad or needs to be charged. It can be reset by turning the power off then on, which also powers-off the attached devices. It will stay silent/working for about 10 days before it begins screeching again - less if I turn on my NAS, which I powered off to "save" the UPS's battery. Disappointed that this didn't last a full year before the battery died.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: So, upfront, this was more of an impulse buy when it was a lightning deal. The other reason is because my apartment loses power somewhat frequently, but only for 2 seconds or less. My PS4 would pop an error every power sag. So I got the UPS to protect my PS4 and prevent the error. This thing cannot do it. Will not swap to internal battery to provide the 1 or 2 seconds of power to a game console that is in standby. Not even powered on, but standby.
customer_reviews.author: Jo D

customer_reviews.title: APC Battery Backup
customer_reviews.text: This battery backup lives up to the APC name. My power quality is good, but both battery backup and surge protection are work having. The spacing on the outlets is good for my monitor transformers. Finally a set of receptacles that aims the transformers over the center, not off the unit making the footprint wider. I only use the power and battery backup features. There is also a USB port I do not use, no doubt it works properly. I will purchase another of these next time one of my UPS backups fails.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Palmer

customer_reviews.title: It's refurbished!
customer_reviews.text: It is a refurbished item, Amazon choice item, not listed as refurbished.
customer_reviews.author: skizy

customer_reviews.title: Beep Beep BEEEEEEP
customer_reviews.text: I honestly hate this because it beeps at you when it's active. Why do you think we bought you, you little UPS punk? To let us know that you're doing your job? That's what you were supposed to do. I don't yell at my boss after finishing my tasks. Stop screaming at me when you were doing it. I can't turn you off, either? We're just UPS buddies for life? No, no I don't like the tone of that beep. Besides that it obviously works, just. SHUT UP.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: It had one job. ONE JOB.
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought this to plug my router and other electronics into for power brown outs which were causing issues with my connectivity. It seemed to work okay for awhile and then after about 3 months my wifi kept disconnecting from every device and having unexplainable issues. I plugged everything into the wall and stopped using this thing and all the other problems went away (except for the power brownout but that's actually more tolerable). It failed at it's only job.
customer_reviews.author: An. On.

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this power back up for about a year now. I was meaning to disconnect the power to make sure the unit is working properly but the building has a power outage yesterday and saved me the trouble. The power was only off for about 15 mins but everything with this unit worked like it should. Immediately switched over and my internet connection was never even missed-which is the main reason I bought the unit- to protect my power for my internet connection. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Buy one and see!
customer_reviews.text: I got these due to the storms always taking the power out. These work really great. It’s been months and months since I’ve bought these and I wanted to wait until I really tested them out. There is no weird smell. When the power goes out there isn’t even an interruption in my internet or TV. I have two now, but will be buying another one for another entertainment center. Yes, these are a must have.
customer_reviews.author: reading

customer_reviews.title: This has nothing to do with Wifi?? As a UPS it is fine
customer_reviews.text: For some reason it asked my to rate the WiFi on it and sleep mode. Neither of which it has. But as a UPS it is very good. Unlike a lot of the newer APC UPS's this one has a replaceable battery so you do not need to toss a perfectly good UPS when the battery goes bad. I tried to take apart another APC UPS and gave up as it would have needed the case ruined to get at the battery. Having the battery being removable was a primary decision to purchase this one.
customer_reviews.author: K&K

customer_reviews.title: Hope you don’t experience a problem - No support whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this as a back up for an adjustable bed when the power goes out. Problem is that apparently the default setting for the alarm is silent mode therefore it does not wake me up in the night and I am unable to get out of bed due to muscular dystrophy. Tech support is nonexistent with no returnEd Messages on any format. Manual on their website does not download and it came without the instruction manual. Hate to have to buy another back up but this one is useless for me. Very frustrating . Why can’t they just have an on and off switch for the alarm??
customer_reviews.author: Jan B.

customer_reviews.title: Works good.
customer_reviews.text: Backup has already proved useful. I work from home and have to have my computer for work. Before getting this backup, if my power went out I lost my work. Now, it gives me time to save stuff and I can continue some to work as long as our cable doesn't go out too. My husband also has one for his computer at his work.
customer_reviews.author: Rain Cloud

customer_reviews.title: 1st power failure this shut off
customer_reviews.text: I will change my star rating if I can get this to work right, but the first power outage, my computer and everything plugged into this all shut down instantly. I am not sure if I did something wrong, but I connect the main battery, plugged it into the wall, turned it on, plugged in my computer and hard drives. Solid green light on the system, then power went out along with everything plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Okay for bridging short power outages
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent "dumb" UPS for non-critical applications. Fine for lamps or charging phones in a pinch, or for keeping a PC up for a couple minutes. Has no sensors, so it cannot automatically shut your PC down for you during longer blackouts. Works fine for little applications like a Raspberry Pi running Home Assistant, so that your house's "brain" stays up during short power downtime.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip K. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: You'll need to download PowerChute software to silence the alarm.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little brother to the XS 1500 series. Needing something simply for lighting in the main room of the house, this little UPS is more than adequate. LED light bulbs take very little power, this little UPS has the ability to supply approximately SIX HOURS worth or normal lighting during a power outage on one lamp. You WILL want to download the PowerChute software and install it on your PC though, as it's the only way to adjust the units settings.
customer_reviews.author: Omega

customer_reviews.title: Not great, but mostly gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I could be wrong, but I believe the one I received was a refurbished unit. The packaging was very questionable, as if it had been opened, used, and repacked. One of the outlets "died" in a brown-out. Not exactly sure what happened. The printer powered up, battery kicked on, monitor turned off. Ever since that outlet the monitor was hooked up to doesn't work. The rest of it works fine though. All in all, it gets the job done. I'd give it 5 stars if it weren't for the dead outlet and fact that it seemed to be refurbished but was sold-as-new.
customer_reviews.author: QwikF3
